message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD), which can be treated with Buspirone. Diazepam can be used for short-term relief, but it is not recommended for long-term use due to its potential for dependence. Family therapy and support groups may help with coping but are not the first-line treatment for GAD.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with symptoms of anxiety, including muscle tension, constant worrying, and difficulty sleeping. Buspirone is a common medication used to treat generalized anxiety disorder. Diazepam is a benzodiazepine used as a short-term solution for anxiety, but is associated with withdrawal symptoms if used long-term. Family therapy and support groups may be helpful as adjunctive therapies, but medication is the recommended initial treatment for generalized anxiety disorder.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Since the patient is presenting with symptoms of anxiety, Buspirone, an anxiolytic medication, would be the best course of treatment. Diazepam is also an anxiolytic but may have more potential for abuse and dependency. Family therapy and support groups may be helpful in addition to medication, but they do not address the primary symptoms directly.
